description.narrative: The project will improve the resilience and delivery of urban services and facilities in eight municipalities in the southern Terai region of Nepal bordering India, including four municipalities from the less-developed Province 7 in far western Nepal. The project will support municipal infrastructure investments, urban planning, and institutional strengthening. The eight cities have high population growth rates, are severely lacking investment, and are experiencing a high level of environmental degradation.

participating-org.narrative: Department of Urban Development and Building Construction-Kailali Division

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President

description.narrative: Quality, sustainability, and disaster resilience of urban services, and competitiveness in eight municipalities of the Terai region improved

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President
At least 50% of fecal sludge is collected and treated in Province 7 project municipalities (2016 baseline: 0)

description.narrative: Quality, sustainability, and disaster resilience of urban services, and competitiveness in eight municipalities of the Terai region improved

title.narrative: Solid waste from at least 65% of households is collected, recycled and disposed in sanitary landfills in Province 7 project municipalities (2016 baseline: 0%)

description.narrative: Quality, sustainability, and disaster resilience of urban services, and competitiveness in eight municipalities of the Terai region improved

title.narrative: Travel time on project roads in all 8 project municipalities reduced by an average of 50% (2016 baseline: 25 minutes per 10 km)

description.narrative: Quality, sustainability, and disaster resilience of urban services, and competitiveness in eight municipalities of the Terai region improved

title.narrative: By 2023: Flood inundation period in core areas (24,000 hectares) reduced to less than 1 hour (2016 baseline: average of 5 hours)

description.narrative: Quality, sustainability, and disaster resilience of urban services, and competitiveness in eight municipalities of the Terai region improved
